Determine the solution quantity \(\mathbb{L}\) the equation \(\left\vert x + {@v1@}\right\vert = {@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\).

\(\mathbb{L}\,=\,\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

Notes:

  • Write the amount with curly clips and separate the solutions with comma, e.g. {1, 3}
  • Letter You empty quantity as {}.

generalfeedback.text:
Lösungsweg:

Die Gleichung \(\left\vert x + {@v1@}\right\vert = {@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) kann z.B. mit Hilfe der Fallunterscheidung gelöst werden.

Fall 1: \(\displaystyle \quad x \geq {@-v1@}\).

\(x+{@v1@}={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad (1-{@v2@})\cdot x = -{@v3@}-{@v1@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad ({@1-v2@})\cdot x = {@-v3-v1@} \) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad x = \displaystyle{@l1@} \) ist eine Lösung, da \( \displaystyle{@l1@} \geq {@-v1@}\).

Fall 2: \(\displaystyle \quad x < {@-v1@}\).

\(-(x+{@v1@})={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad -x-{@v1@}={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad (-1-{@v2@}) \cdot x=-{@v3@}+{@v1@}\)  \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad ({@-1-v2@}) \cdot x={@-v3+v1@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad x= \displaystyle{@l2@}\) ist keine Lösung, da \( \displaystyle{@l2@} > {@-v1@}\).

Aus den beiden Fällen ergibt sich dann die Lösungsmenge \(\mathbb{L} = \displaystyle {@loesung@}\).

Solution:

The equation \(\left\vert x + {@v1@}\right\vert = {@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) can be solved, for example, with the aid of the case differentiation.

Case 1: \(\displaystyle \quad x \geq {@-v1@}\).

\(x+{@v1@}={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad (1-{@v2@})\cdot x = -{@v3@}-{@v1@}\)\(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad ({@1-v2@})\cdot x = {@-v3-v1@} \)\(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad x = \displaystyle{@l1@} \) is a solution, since \( \displaystyle{@l1@} \geq {@-v1@}\).

Case 2: \(\displaystyle \quad x < {@-v1@}\).

\(-(x+{@v1@})={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad -x-{@v1@}={@v2*x@}-{@v3@}\)\(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad (-1-{@v2@}) \cdot x=-{@v3@}+{@v1@}\)\(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad ({@-1-v2@}) \cdot x={@-v3+v1@}\) \(\quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad x= \displaystyle{@l2@}\) is not a solution, since \( \displaystyle{@l2@} > {@-v1@}\).

The solution quantity is then obtained from the two cases. \(\mathbb{L} = \displaystyle {@loesung@}\).
